Filter¶

Numbers¶

pycollector.filter.numbers.integer(num)¶
Parameters:num (string) – string to be converted to an int
pycollector.filter.numbers.decimal(num)¶
Parameters:num (string) – string to be converted to a float
pycollector.filter.numbers.clean_number_string(num)¶

takes a string representing a number and removes commas, returns a string removes commas from a number 1,234 returns 1234

Parameters:num (string) – string representing a number, potentially with commas in it
pycollector.filter.numbers.currency_from_string(num)¶

takes a string representing a number and returns a new string formatted to two decimal places “1,234,567” => “1234567.00”

Parameters:num (string) – string representing a currency amount
pycollector.filter.numbers.currency_from_number(num)¶

takes a float/int and returns a string representing the number with two decimal places 1234.567 => “1234.57”

Strings¶

pycollector.filter.strings.clean_whitespace(text)¶

given a string, replace instances of 1+ whitespace characters with a single space strip all whitespace off the ends of the string

Parameters:text (string) – string with extra whitespace
pycollector.filter.strings.clean_extra_spaces(text)¶

given a string, replace instances of 2+ spaces with a single space strip all whitespace off the ends of the string

Parameters:text (string) – string with extra spaces
